record.attribute:
EuPathDB is pleased to announce the members of the scientific working group (SWG). The SWG provides EuPathDB with scientific oversight and guidance.

John Boothroyd, Co-Chair
Stanford University
Toxoplasma biology & host-pathogen interactions
 Michael Gottlieb, Co-Chair
Foundation for National Institutes of Health (FNIH)
Broad expertise in parasitology, large integrative projects (chair)

University College Dublin

University of Oxford
Molecular Microbiology

University of Zurich
Functional genomics, Biology Giardia & Toxoplasma
Malcolm McConville
Bio21, Melbourne University
Metabolomics & drug discovery, Plasmodium, Toxoplasma, Leishmania
John Taylor
University of California, Berkeley
Fungal evolution & Comparative genomics
Brett Tyler
Oregon State University
Oomycete biology & Pathogenesis
 Sarah Volkman
Harvard University & Broad Institute
Malaria geneticist & ICEMR engagement

• The EuPathDB Data Summary provides an overview of the content in EuPathDB across sites, all organisms and data types covered.
  • The EuPathDB Gene Metrics Table summarizes the number of genes for the organisms currently available in EuPathDB, by various datatypes.

There are several kinds of downloads available in a EuPathDB site:
  • Download files that we create at release time. The link to access these files is under the menu item "Downloads":"Data Files". These include fasta files for all available sequences, gff files with complete gene information, and other formats.
  • Download files with results generated by running searches. From a result page (after running a search) a user can access the "Download Results" link, to a new page where a few different download formats are offered. The file for download includes all IDs in the result. The user selects a format and, in some formats, the user may request additional information about each ID in the result: single valued attributes (e.g., exon count for a geneID) and multi-valued tables (e.g., set of EC numbers for a geneID).
  • Download fasta files from the Sequence Retrieval Tool, under the menu item "Tools":"Sequence Retrieval".
  • Download files that have been uploaded by the community in our websites, available under "Downloads" or "Community".
  • Downloadable EuPathDB publications, under the menu item "Downloads".

EuPathDB wishes to acknowledge:

  • All the community members who have contributed data (often pre-publication), entered user comments or sent us their suggestions.

  • Scientists who provided images to be used as a template for the logos in our websites. These are:

    • AmoebaDB: Dr. Graham Clark (London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine), Dr. Fiona Henriquez (University of West Scotland), Dr. William Petri (University of Virginia), Dr. Craig Roberts (University of Strathclyde)
    • GiardiaDB: Dr. Fran Gillin, Dr. Tineke Lauwaet and Dr. Barbara Davids (University of California, San Diego)
    • MicrosporidiaDB: Dr. Louis Weiss (Albert Einstein School of Medicine)
    • PiroplasmaDB: Dr. Ellen Yeh (Stanford) for proposing the logo idea. Dr. Lowell Kappemeyer, Dr. Audrey Lau (University of Washington) and Dr. Dirk Dobbelaere (University of Bern) for supplying images.
    • PlasmoDB: Dr. Pedro Moura for providing images of Giemsa stained parasites
    • ToxoDB: Dr. Boris Striepen (University of Georgia)
    • TrichDB: Antonio Pereira-Neves and Marlene Benchimol, Santa Ursula University, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
    • TriTrypDB: Dr. Rick Tarleton (University of Georgia)
